solution_line_template: For the second month, Sam earned ${first_month_earnings} + ${additional_earnings_second_month} = $<<{first_month_earnings}+{additional_earnings_second_month}={second_month_earnings}>>{second_month_earnings}.

So, he earned a total of ${first_month_earnings} +${second_month_earnings} = $<<{first_month_earnings}+{second_month_earnings}={total_earnings_two_months}>>{total_earnings_two_months} for the first two months.
Therefore, he spent ${total_earnings_two_months}/${hourly_rate} = <<{total_earnings_two_months}/{hourly_rate}={total_hours}>>{total_hours} hours on math tutoring for the first two months
